title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Nov. 5)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Acton saw multiple home sales including a Colonial on Silver Hill Road sold for $1,160,000 with 4 bedrooms.
Allston's highest recent sale was a two-family duplex on Aldie Street for $1,600,000 with 6 bedrooms.
In Belmont, a Colonial on Woodbine Road sold for $2,500,000, featuring 7 bedrooms and 5 baths.

title: ‘Landslide’: Santana beats out Baker, Wu says, while Culpepper wins D7
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Henry Santana secures reelection to Boston City Council, defeating former Councilor Frank Baker per unofficial results.
Rev. Miniard Culpepper wins the District 7 seat, succeeding Tania Fernandes Anderson, with a lead over Said Ahmed.
All district council incumbents win reelection, maintaining the current composition of the Boston City Council.

title: Jake Wilson to be Somerville’s next mayor, unofficial results show
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jake Wilson won Somerville's mayoral race with 11,185 votes according to unofficial results, defeating opponent Willie Burnley Jr. who received 9,054 votes.
Wilson's campaign focused on improving city services and addressing issues such as housing, street safety, and rodent control in Somerville.
Incoming mayor Jake Wilson has experience in media and communications and served as President of Somerville Youth Soccer and on the City Council.

title: Lowell police seeking public’s help with details about fatal hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Lowell police request public assistance for information on a fatal hit-and-run occurring October 30 on Chelmsford Street.
A pedestrian was struck and killed; police have identified the vehicle but seek more details from witnesses.
The Middlesex District Attorney's office and police units are investigating; tips can be reported at 978-937-3200.

title: ‘This is just the beginning’: Nonbinding Israel divestment ballot question passes in Somerville
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Somerville's nonbinding Question 3 to divest from Israeli-supporting companies passed with 55.7% support in unofficial results.
Somerville for Palestine gathered over 11,000 signatures to support the measure, despite opposition from Somerville United Against Discrimination.
The ballot measure encourages divestment from companies linked to Israel's actions, aiming to direct city leaders to implement policies.

title: Tom Brady just revealed that his dog Junie is a clone of Lua, his deceased furry friend
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Tom Brady revealed his new dog Junie is a clone of his deceased dog Lua, created by Colossal Biosciences.
Brady utilized Colossal's non-invasive cloning technology to revive Lua, who died in December 2023, using a blood sample.
Colossal Biosciences recently acquired Viagen, a leading animal cloning company known for cloning various species since 2002.

title: Running unopposed, Michelle Wu secures second term as her national profile grows
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu secured her second term running unopposed, winning over 91% of counted votes.
Wu, the first woman and person of color elected as Boston mayor, gained national attention opposing Trump policies.
Wu implemented fare-free buses in Dorchester and pursued rent stabilization, maintaining a 66% favorability rating.

title: Tell us: What should Mayor Wu focus on in her second term?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu is expected to secure a second term, running unopposed after challenger Josh Kraft dropped out.
Wu's first term focused on housing affordability, immigration tensions, and climate goals, despite mixed feedback on pace and effectiveness.
Boston.com invites public input on Wu's priorities for her next term, including housing, climate resiliency, and public safety.

title: ‘This is kidnapping — plain and simple’: ICE arrests 9 employees at Allston car wash
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents detained nine employees at Allston Car Wash in a raid Tuesday morning.
Manager Jose Barrera stated the employees, all with work permits, were detained without the chance to present documents.
Boston City Councilor Liz Breadon condemned the raid, urging affected individuals to seek legal assistance from local organizations.

title: Patriots opt to stand pat at trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots chose not to make any trades, keeping their current roster intact at the NFL trade deadline.
New England is currently on a six-game winning streak, holding a 7-2 record in the 2025 season.
Recent trades out include Keion White and Kyle Dugger, impacting the Patriots' depth, especially in defense.
